data.title: Nice local brewery...
data.text: The wife and I came to check it out.  Good solid brews.  Food trucks and local delivery if you need grub.  Can't find anything negative to say.  Friendly folks and a decent atmosphere.  The bar games and such available but really the best part after the beer is the outer area and flat.out good feeling ambience.  Gotta come back.

data.title: Great addition to Hamilton
data.text:
This brewery is the BACK of what used to be the Hamilton Municipal Building. Because that is where the fire department used to be, so they have these extra large garage doors that are always raised and that is what gives the link from the inside to the outside of this place such a uniqueness. The tables are on the massive firetruck driveway with extra bench seating around the perimeter. The ladies room is the original location of the restroom for the firefighters and they have added the men's room. The bar area is the old apparatus room. 
It's next to the river, near the High Street Bridge that leads to Main Street on the west Side and just across the street from the Hotel. 
Great place to have a beer. I do wonder what they are going to do this winter, when so much of their seating is outside. (dog gone). And with the doors down, will you have to enter through the door on the right and come in a different way?
Since my husband is a retired Hamilton Firefighter and was stationed there, we wish this establishment success for sure.

data.title: A great place to enjoy great craft beer!
data.text: great space with indoor and outdoor seating. 7+ house brewed beers on tap ranging from light to dark styles. something for everyone. food truck on site along with food delivery service. Laid back atmosphere that is very welcoming and comfortable. Dog & kid friendly. A must-see. Worth the drive if you dont live in Hamilton. Located in an historic building--unique setting.

data.title: Has that neighborhood bar feel.
data.text: We were staying at hotel across street and walked over to try their beer. They had a good variety, but the neighborly vibe was what made the biggest impression. Almost except a cheer of "Norm!" as new people arrived.

data.title: Great Bday Celebration Spot
data.text: Family and friends. Love this new local brewery. Great beer and friendly patrons always willing to share a table

data.title: Beer is Back in Hamilton
data.text: Great effort by locals at bringing back brewing to Hamilton. We tried the pale Ale and the Blonde. Both were very delicious and it's nice to see they stay seasonal with their offerings. We wish them well

data.title: Bier MIT ein Hund!
data.text: I love the Cincinnati area BOOM of local breweries serving up their craft bier on site...and this one is in my hood so I stop in often.  My wife...not usually a bier drinker. Yes...I spell it Bier...the German way..the right way. : )  She really enjoyed their Woltermelon ale...with a hint of watermelon.  I liked each bier I tried...the Porter and the Rye Ale too. Like most taprooms they do not serve food but rather they have food trucks park on site, you can bring food along or all the local pizza place know the site well.  The open area features limited seating,  corn hole games, and people bring their dogs often....so it is a unique atmosphere.

data.title: Fun!
data.text: Great place to hang out with friends or family. Relaxed casual atmosphere. Loved the beautiful old building.  Really nice outdoor space to enjoy fine craft beer, play games that are available for use, or just sit and talk. Local food trucks rotate, we were lucky to have yummy bbq!  Everyone was super friendly!  If you are in the area, worth checking out!

data.title: Great Atmosphere/Great Beer
data.text:
We visited Municipal Brew Works for the first time today.  The atmosphere was great. We were there on the early afternoon and people were hanging out and playing board games. There were several families there with their children.  

As for the beer, it was ok.  I had their IPA and it wasn't there worst IPA I have had,  but it definitely wasn't up there with some of my favorites (Truth, Heavy Seas, Psychopathy). I only tried their IPA so I can't speak for the other beers. 

Overall I think it was a nice stop and I always recommend checking a place out at least once! From what I understand this is a newer brewery so perhaps over time their IPA will improve.

data.title: Every Thursday game night
data.text: Been meeting my son here for the last few weeks and a great stop for food and beer.  Usually we play some checkers and chess and enjoy the food truck and great local beer.  Love the Hamilton in progress come back..,

data.title: Nice craft beer, nice setting!
data.text: Craft beer is good, nice setting in downtown Hamilton, I loved the rye pale ale best.  They don't serve food, but there are menus on the wall from local restaurants that will deliver your order right to the pub.  We ordered ribs and pork from Neal's Famous BBQ and they worked great!

data.title: Great beer, fun atmosphere
data.text: MBW is a good place to kick back and chat with friends. The set up has an open, neighborly feel. It's located in the back of the old municipal building. Beer is great, as are the staff. They have rotating food trucks or you can bring in your own food. Great addition to Hamilton!
